poem:
Title: "Departure in Three Acts"

In heartland's shadow, a truth unfolds,
Hero turned startled hare, a tale told.
In Congress' hall, echoes a lament,
A home besieged, a courage spent.
Lone hawk in flight, under threat's guise,
Resigns to quiet, family ties.
Gallagher, once of stone, now seeks the unseen,
A life 'bove politics, a realm serene.
Whispers of "prioritize being," he heeds,
In resignation, a new start breeds.
